title: Garden Vegetables Recall
description: How much do you remember about growing seasons, plant families, and vegetable garden lore? Let's find out!

questions.question: Which vegetable family includes tomatoes, peppers, eggplants, and potatoes?
What popular method of raised bed gardening divides the growing space into square-foot sections?
Which vegetable was considered poisonous by many Europeans until the late 1700s?
What are the "Three Sisters" in Native American companion planting?
Which root vegetable can be white, yellow, or even purple, and is often mashed as an alternative to potatoes?
What does "bolting" mean when referring to lettuce or spinach?
options: Developing a flower stalk prematurely due to heat

questions.question: Brussels sprouts grow in what unusual way on the plant?
options: Along a tall stalk, spiraling upward

questions.question: Which vegetable is 95% water, making it one of the most hydrating foods?
What garden practice involves planting a new crop as soon as the previous one is harvested?
Kohlrabi looks unusual compared to most vegetables. What does it most resemble?
options: A satellite with antennae (a swollen stem with leaf stalks)

questions.question: Which legume improves soil by "fixing" nitrogen from the air into the ground?
What is the term for a plant that completes its life cycle in one growing season?
Globe, Jerusalem, and Chinese are all types of which vegetable?
Which herb is traditionally planted near tomatoes as a companion plant to repel pests?
What did World War II-era "Victory Gardens" encourage citizens to do?
options: Grow their own food to support the war effort
